department.dept_long_name: Department of Slavic Languages and Literatures

course.title: Elementary Polish
course.meeting_text: M., W., F., at 9, with an additional hour of speaking practice to be arranged.
course.description: An introductory course in modern Polish language and culture, designed for students without previous knowledge who would like to speak Polish or use the language for reading and research. All four major communicative skills (speaking, listening comprehension, reading, writing) are stressed. Students are exposed to Polish culture through reading of prose and poetry as they learn to use the language both as a means of communication and as a tool for reading and research. This year-long full course satisfies the foreign language requirement and prepares students for continued study of Polish in intermediate-level courses and for study or travel abroad in Poland.
